page.title: 09THE POST OFFICE,BRIGHSTONE
page.content: The Post Office is housed in a delightful thatched building. It has low dark beams and the post_mistress estimated that 5 to 10 people bumped their head every week. Thursday is the busiest day for the post_mistress as this is the day when pensions are paid and there are many pensioners in Brighstone. The invasion of the village by visitors also makes her much busier in summer. In the height of the season the post box is full mainly of postcards showing views from all over the Island and even some places on the mainland as well. The Post Office is a place where locals stop to talk to her and to each other. The post_mistress said that all the different characters made her job very interesting.
